channel.title: Swift
channel.description:
https://developer.apple.com/swift/
If anyone is interested in app development, then I suggest you look here. It doesn't look too terrible.

item.title: Swift

Read full topic

item.title: Swift
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:7, topic:543702”]This might actually turn out well. It’s native, so that’s a good start. I think the worst thing that ever happened to low-powered embedded devices was the use of Java as seen in the Android operating system.
While modern desktop hardware executes Java effortlessly, the same isn’t the case for phones.[/quote]

Well Google are planning to ditch dalvik anyway, ART compiles android apps to a native binary on install. Though whether the code it spits out is efficient is another matter.

Read full topic

item.title: Swift
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

I’ve been using it for the past few days and I absolutely love it. The language is modern and has fast development speed, not to mention the syntax is a million times better than objective-c (although it has hints of obj-c here’n’there). Highly recommend if you want to get into iOS or OS X app development.

Read full topic

item.title: Swift
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

This might actually turn out well. It’s native, so that’s a good start. I think the worst thing that ever happened to low-powered embedded devices was the use of Java as seen in the Android operating system.
While modern desktop hardware executes Java effortlessly, the same isn’t the case for phones.
